recommendations.description: Seton Gakuen is also in a high school setting but has anthro animals instead of monsters as characters with a male lead.

Gojo and Kakashi might as well be the same character! Silver haired, overpowered teacher who at first Funny the students, or is at best aloof and carefree around them. The protagonists are also similar, in the sense that they have their own goals unrelated to the schools they attend, and getting stronger just happens to be the path to that goal
Their both really similar and I think that a lot of people would enjoy it. Like for example Naruto has a demon trapped inside of him, and so does the main character in Jujutsu kaisen Itadori.
their MCs are both children

recommendation.title: Nanatsu no Maken ga Shihai suru

recommendations.description: MC of this series has a personality similar to Lelouch from Code Geass, possess a very special/powerful ability, revenge-driven.
Do you like deep conversations being shoved at you that have little to do with the plot and an unnecesarily confusing story? Go check the other anime.

same kind of psychology duel between protag and antagonist + another anime where u question whats wrong or right you dont know for what side you should root for since theres a morality dilemma that can taint your judgement on the "bad" guys. it also succeed where death note fails a few times. 
have fun watching <3

Both are very slow paced mysteries told in a non-linear way. If you want to grab the little pieces and make a puzzle out of what you watch, both are the best for you. Mind you, they're both dense and confusing.

Ah, they're both works of Madhouse too.
Both time travel related and had a very intriguing story
Dual! Parallel Trouble Adventure is more light-hearted compared to the always depressed Shinji.

recommendation.title: Higurashi no Naku Koro ni Gou

recommendations.description: Higurashi Gou and Boogiepop Phantom are mystery anime taking place in a single story with a connected set of characters. They're both also horror and have some of the same gross out creepy aspects while maintaining a good atmosphere at times. If you like one you'll like the other.

Oshi no Ko is another twisted anime to watch if you liked the plot twists and confusion of Boogiepop And Other.

Not certain Oshi no Ko Have same dementia

Both slow down the pace. These are not action shows really. The put emphasis on colors and symbols. Not necessarily what something is, but what it means. Hidden details add much more to the story when thought about.

In both anime there are fights between Mecha VS monsters, Sometimes there are also fights between humans, One of the things that changes is that Synduality Noir is more comedy than Muv-Luv Alternative

Both are sci-fi action flicks with androids as protagonists that contemplate similar questions: meaning of being alive, finality of death, religion, AI cognizance, etc. Similar post-apocalyptic settings. Casshern has a more melancholic tone on the whole.
Both are action-oriented sci-fi shows that take place during a war between humanity and artificial lifeforms and similarly follow androids fighting for humans.

Both are post-apocalyptic sci-fi shows that have androids as protags and that deal with similar themes/topics (e.g. what it means to be alive). Nier:Automata is more on the actiony side in comparison.
Arranged marriages filled with gut busting humor. Likable characters and sprinkles of fan service.

liked.title: Sumomomo Momomo: Chijou Saikyou no Yome

recommendations.description: Both have the world of people with superpowers and mysteries
A small group of people wander around a barren world and have intimate and reflective moments together.

Where there are paranormal activities, there also exists a normal life with ordinary people. Both shows focus on protagonists who combat these paranormal activities to maintain peace in the normal world.
Cute girls dealing with the problems of love and life.

recommendation.title: Mushoku Tensei II: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu

recommendations.description:
Both anime focus on the protagonists journey to finding meaning in life, and to lead a fulfilling life
Both anime are action/adventure with many characters
Both anime are serious in nature, with the occasional comic relief
Both MCs become depressed in some parts of their life
Both anime gradually covers the protagonists entire life, from child to adulthood (seeing characters age and wide scale events unfold)
Both anime have a focus on family values, and not just about being a ruthless killer or a battle hungry warrior

recommendation.title: Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute! 2nd Season

recommendations.description: Overlord is the golden standard for isekais, I like that both the main characters have their stories started by a misunderstanding of the extremely intelligent subordinates. I also like how insanely OP they both are.

The Eminence in Shadow is far inferior to Overlord in many ways, but they both contain the incredibly specific trope of a guy being reincarnated into a fantasy world where he suddenly gains much power and many subordinates, and as a result he has to keep up the act of a perfect and all-knowing leader (when he is really no such thing).
Both short movies for educational purposes regarding nuclear abolition through the drama of anthropomorphic animals

liked.title: Tobiuo no Boy wa Byouki desu

recommendations.description: the protagonist make articulated and complicated plans that reveal interesting plot, like the mc and the shadow garden.

recommendation.title: Kage no Jitsuryokusha ni Naritakute! 2nd Season

recommendations.description:
Both involve a protagonist who is given supernatural powers and creates a masked persona to go by. They both use their newfound powers under their said guises and create a rebel organization dedicated towards fighting the currupt governments and sinister groups respectively. Cid and Lelouch are also very similar in personality. While Cid is also a lot less serious and brooding than Lelouch and tends to act like a fool (both on purpose and accident) but like Lelouch he's got a sadistic side to him. He also implies that he has a master plan that he wants to take himself down to, which Lelouch also shares.

Code Geass is more story driven with a far more serious tone and theme, along with a more centralized and developed cast. While Eminence feels more like a parody, with many character introductions skimmed or skipped. But there's just enough weight and a ton of self-consciousness to keep it both refreshing and fun to watch. 

Code Geass is definitely the better show, but even in direct comparison Eminence holds up well - and is a solid recommendation for fans of one to go to the other.

liked.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch R2

recommendations.description: The protagonist is suddenly thrown into a "battle-royale-like" environment where everyone is an enemy. The female lead met along becomes the most valuable person to the protagonist
The Art style is similar. Especially, how they both feel isekai-ish
Finding out who's the "Extra one", which will decide their survival seems the same in both anime.

Strong female character.
Overcoming trauma and hardships.
Learning to understand the world and others in it.
This is about a spirit gardian that use its spirits power for defendin a shrine burried under it's highschool.

recommendation.title: Ryza no Atelier: Tokoyami no Joou to Himitsu no Kakurega

recommendations.description: The premise of these two anime is to create items using alchemy. Both stars female MCs.
Both of them are misleading and much darker than what they initially seem. If you know either of them, you know what I mean.

The sister somewhat resembles Anya. The MC somewhat resembles Anya's parents. With so many overpowered, unlikely, and supernatural things, I'd say that you should consider watching Spy x Family if you like this anime.
Both shows depict young adult in their working life. Filled with humor and a little bit of romance.

Imagine if you got a manic pixie dream girl but she sucked

Both follow depressed male protagonists in their journey to get better and find themselves, and their relationship with a female character who is a hot mess in her own right

Both these titles are about acquiring items, either by stealing (Lupin III) or by archeology (Montana Jones). The episodes are pretty much stand alone, with the characters having adventures in different parts of the world. The main character team consists of the some males, and a female (who can be actually useful if she wants).
There is also an antagonist who shows up in almost every episode. His name starts with Z. However, Zenigata in Lupin III is on the side of law and order, and Dr. Zero on the opposite side.

If found these titles quite enjoyable as episodic adventure stories.
Some of concepts that went into the Individual Eleven plot arc as well as the refugee plot arc are somewhat similar to the later part of the movie

liked.title: Koukaku Kidoutai: Stand Alone Complex 2nd GIG

recommendations.description: Some of the ideas from Re:Cyborg regarding war industry and consciousness were also present in SAC2045. A certain character was also inspired by Joe Shimamura.
The Reopening is a sort of pilot for Re:Cyborg, many parts from Oshii's short made it into Kamiyama's movie

recommendation.title: Boku no Kokoro no Yabai Yatsu

recommendations.description:
Kubo is basically a milder, inferior version of Bokuyaba.

It does have sturdier visuals though.
Both are great science fiction classics with a lot of psychology.
Both are great science fiction classics set in Neo Tokyo.
Both are about time travel psychologically and the storys are kinda similar, going to the past solve everything be done

It's pretty much the same concept, all characters got blocked into a video game, i personally found log horizon more exciting then sao because of the characters and the plot but that's for you guys to decide

recommendation.title: Genjitsu Shugi Yuusha no Oukoku Saikenki

recommendations.description: both stories share similarities in the idea of making political reform to make improvement in that another world. someone from another world that will bringing technology and political reforms will save world. both Mc in the story in concept personality are similar.

liked.title: Choujin Koukousei-tachi wa Isekai demo Yoyuu de Ikinuku you desu!

recommendations.description: They are both very hilarious and so unique. It’s hard to find many good, well developed, non-cliché characters like the main characters in both of these. In every episode, you are sure to be laughing and I highly recommend watching them.
Studio Ghibli movies that just feel similar to me, not sure why but it might be the strong connections the characters have or the drama aspect ( and also because both movies feels like queerbait-)

The humor in Saiki and AssClass is quite similar, as are the way all its characters interact. They're both based on a premise having to do with an irregular character with powers and take place largely at a school. AssClass is far more plot-based and ends up being more serious and Saiki leaves more room for pure comedy, however.

While No Game No Life has a much different setting (fantasy isekai), both of these shows are all about a guy (with the help of a girl) who partakes in games where players are pit in a psychological battle of wits. Lots of layers of outmaneuvering your opponent.  I think if liked the games in one show, you'd also like the other.
Both anime feature similarly convoluted psychological games in an environment that pits friends or sudents against each other in a high-stakes setting.
Both anime feature a school for high stakes games where challenger students provide game rules to determine victory.
They both have that great comedy-action mix that's really enjoyable to watch (at least for me), and complex characters with emotional backstories that manage to get you every time.

Has similar dynamics such as the supernatural and plotline aspects. Involves MC gaining/finding their power although one is based in a detective agency and the other enters the schooling scene. Both have humorous tones although they follow a serious man vs self conflict. TW for Bungou stray dogs as it has suicide/abuse themes. Both are in the action genre so violence and death is included.
One of the best post-apocalyptic titles that have ever been released. Stunning visuals, intriguing plot, great world-building & inexpressible atmosphere. Must-have show

Both are more family-oriented animes. They both are really amazing animes. Violet is a automemories doll basically she types up letters. Spy x Family is basically a secret family under the disguise of a normal family. Both are quite nice, Spy X Family is more comedic though,
Both are comedies. Saiki K is more supernatural as he has psychic powers but both are High School comedies. They overreact to everyday occurrences. Saiki K mom best character in show
Both are High School comedy animes. Both have emphasis on school but Saiki does 50/50 school and outside school. Saiki is more supernatural as he has psychic powers while Danshi is just normal.
Both are Girl High School animes. Both are comedic animes. Minami K is more about home life while Nichijou is more about school life. They both excel in exaggerating daily occurences
Both are High School comedic animes. Danshi focuses on boys and school life while Minami K is more home life.
Both are High School girl animes. Both are quite the comedies. Minami K focuses more on the home life while Azumanga Daioh is more School Life.
Both are racing animes. They also have interesting main characters haha. Ones a Datsun 240z while the other is a Toyota AE86
Both are racing related
Both are very light Slice of Life animes. The plot trots along and everything is super relaxing. It is quite nice.
Both are High School romance animes, although Horimiya takes more romance into stance while Gekkan Shojou is more about manga art. But still both have romance themes in it and both are quite funny.
Both are college students related. They both also have a MC who loves to scuba dive. Josee is a bit more romance related while Grand Blue is just college students goofing off haha

They both have strong messages in them, released in the same year. Both are great watches! They have heavy romance themes in it as well. A little comedy drizzled in Silent Voice. Silent Voice and YOur Name are sad as well. Your Name has AMAZING animation and music while Silent Voice makes u feel for it more.
both are single dads raising a younger child. Ive been told not to read the Usagi Drop manga haha. But they both have amazing lessons.
Both have a younger child as a MC. Usagi Drop was good, don't read the manga is what I've been told haha

Both raise a younger child. Both are comedy-focused too. Both have writing in similar. Kakushigoto the dad is a manga author trying to hide it from the daughter while Barakamon the guy us a calligrapher but instead he openly shows it and teaches it to the island.
Both are daily lives of high school girls. Azumanga Daioh has Osaka, the best and only reason to watch the anime. They like to over exxagerate everyday occurrences.

Asobi is the girl version of Danshi Kokose, except Asobi is more nefarious haha. Both overexaggerate everyday occurrences. They have *some* romance but barely anything. Both of them are a group of either 3 guys or 3 girls.
They both are girls in school doing nefarious things. They both exaggerate everyday occurrences. They both also have AMAZING expressions haha. Good watch!
both very similar in characters and comedy

- Sentouin has pretty good comedy timing (if you liked the comedy in konosuba, you'll probably like it in Sentouin too)
- The MCs from both shows have incredibly similar personalities, the difference being that agent six (from Sentouin) is a little bit more "aggressive"
- Both MCs were thrown into a new world carrying a woman with them
- There is a blue-haired, airhead, and money-focused FMC in both shows
- Even if the plot does not hook you, you'll probably laugh through every episode, just like in konosuba.

liked.title: Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Shukufuku wo!

recommendations.description:
-Both have spikey hair that can go up and turn gold.
-Has a rival anti-hero who changes in the later episodes.
-Both have 7 items that power up the user and the other wish for stuff.
-Has a best friend Tails/Krillin since the Og days such as Classic Sonic era and Og Dragon ball.

I found the visuals of both these films gorgeous. In Birth, it was more the animation, in Kaijuu no Kodomo, more the background art.
In many scenes, there are people falling or floating.
Not many words are spoken, and if there are, they did not make much sense to me...
The stories were somehow about birth and rebirth and cosmic forces, but I could not really follow, because during the beautiful scenes, my thoughts were wandering somewhere else and I found myself dozing off, which I consider as a bad sign regarding entertainment value.

But for someone who can sit through almost 2 hours just for the beautiful art, I think these films can be recommended.
People like me who expect a story may use these films as visual sleeping pills.
Samurai Champloo resembles Gintama in being a more action oriented version. Like Gintama, the main trio meet by chance and wander together, with each member  having a different aim.

Creative spins on idols. The music and performances are both strong in their own rights for both. Zombieland Saga parodies the more traditional side and takes a more comedic tone, while Symphogear leans into its action

recommendation.title: Shi Zhi Ge: Hua Yu Yan De Kuangxiang Shi

recommendations.description:
Similarities:
-the main character behavior is quite similar (not exactly the same)
-both stories have the sense of mystery in the identity of the main character
-both fighting with robots
Differences:
-the stores are different Shi Zhi Ge is more of a magic world - adventure - friends/company type 
-while Beng Huai Xing He is more of space world - military - war

recommendation.title: Honzuki no Gekokujou: Shisho ni Naru Tame ni wa Shudan wo Erandeiraremasen

recommendations.description:
If you appreciate that Slime breaks the isekai norm by focusing more on politics, society, and development than on combat or slice-of-life, Ascendance of a Bookworm takes it further and is entirely focused on politics, society, development, and economics.
Both series are about the protagonist's rise in influence, though while that influence is won through battle quickly and easily in slime, the protagonist of Ascendance of a Bookworm struggles immensely for every inch of progress.

recommendation.title: Dekiru Neko wa Kyou mo Yuuutsu

recommendations.description: Slice of life comedy series following the misadventures of someone you normally wouldn't see in daily life. The odd person takes care of and bends over backwards for their loved one.
The opening sequence of the barren landscape in HMC immediately reminded me of Listeners' setting. Both series also have a major focus on music, and mecha with highly stylized characters.

Murder mystery? Horror? main character who feels terrorized? Suspicious friend? Conspiracy?
Higurashi is similar to Chäos;HEAd
Both have similar fight scenes, similar style mythology and medieval style Japanese villages

recommendation.title: Nakitai Watashi wa Neko wo Kaburu

recommendations.description: Both movies have cat transformation, different realms/worlds, some sort of weird love problem and both are beautiful stories.

The movies both explore the themes of death, loss, depression and grieving.
They also both have a fantasy aspect to the story.
If you love 1 phantom thief, try 3!

• Both are long running series

• In both the series MC and his crew goes to new places and makes new friends and enemies. 

• Both the MC have big dream one of them want to be a Pokemon master on the other hand another wants to become King of the Pirates. 

• Both the anime have perfect balance of serious and non seriousness in them.

Both series are visually unique, surreal and satirical dramedies that serve as critiques on the concept of blood relations and how far one can go for people they have nothing in common with but being family.

It's not secret that Kill la Kill is a retread of Re: Cutey Honey. Many of the same staff worked on both, including director Hiroyuki Imaishi, and it greatly shows, with their unconventional take on magical girls, high amounts of nudity, general tongue in cheek tone, bombastic action, similar visual style and of course the yuri, any fan of either is sure to love the other.

recommendation.title: Sword Art Online: Alicization - War of Underworld

recommendations.description:
SAO: hey can I copy your homework? 

GATE: Sure, but don't make it obvious. 

SAO: Alright, let me get rid of the MC and I suppose I will have no harem then... oh wait, that doesn't work. Also I am gonna steal the Genkidama and this Goku character from my other neighbor. They probably won't mind.

recommendations.description:
Arranged marriage
the heroine is treated badly
the mc is kind
both have the same vibe
Is awesome ,I recommend these two animes (10/10) one of the best sports anime ever

recommendations.description:
-mc has dull perspective on life
-female lead is full of life and pretty
-friends to lovers

-female lead is in the beauty industry (modeling/actress)

liked.title: Seishun Buta Yarou wa Bunny Girl Senpai no Yume wo Minai

recommendation.title: Tensei Oujo to Tensai Reijou no Mahou Kakumei

recommendations.description: Genuine warm fuzzies between female leads. Mutual admiration - one loud, and one quiet. A romance plot that was explicitly designed to make you think "I want that" and that such a goal is attainable (minus any fantastical actual magic or anime-ridiculousness).

recommendation.title: Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu Part 2

recommendations.description: Depression being overcome through good friends
Both are videoclips from the same creator and the same artist, with cutesy animation covering a creepy and depressing story. If you like some fluid animation please check out the other one!
